intro: Euphrasia bipinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Euphrasia bipinnatifida is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
